comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110928134238

Steps to reproduce:

Normal browsing. Had Emsisoft anti-malware w/File Guard, Behavior Blocker, and Surf Protection on. Then disabled all three....no change.


Actual results:

After (perhaps coincidentally?)"syncing", a number of sites either won't open ("FireFox can't find server at ".....", try again"), or open to a partial, incoherent window.


Expected results:

All of the windows not opening, or opening improperly, should have opened.....well, properly!

Actual results:

comments.text:
>FireFox can't find server
Firefox can't resolve the name and that is usually a sign of network or firewall  issues.
comments.author: bugzilla@mversen.de
comments.creator: bugzilla@mversen.de
comments.raw_text:
>FireFox can't find server
Firefox can't resolve the name and that is usually a sign of network or firewall  issues.
